articles.headline: A Director Decides to Override a Friendship
articles.snippet: When Robert L. Nardelli refused to accept a pay cut, he lost the crucial support of Kenneth G. Langone, a director at Home Depot.
articles.abstract: When Robert L. Nardelli refused to accept a pay cut, he lost the crucial support of Kenneth G. Langone, a director at Home Depot.
articles.lead_paragraph: Everyone who knows him says it: In a tough fight, Kenneth G. Langone is a guy you want in your corner.

articles.headline: Gadflies Get Respect, and Not Just at Home Depot
articles.snippet: An activist investor led the campaign against Home Depot’s management and strategy that culminated in the ouster of its chief executive.
articles.abstract: An activist investor led the campaign against Home Depot’s management and strategy that culminated in the ouster of its chief executive.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, activist shareholders were an entertaining, but largely ignored, Wall Street sideshow. Disgruntled investors would attend annual meetings to harangue executives, criticize strategies — and protest that their complaints were being ignored. One agitator appeared in face paint and a red nose after executives called him a clown.

articles.headline: Gap Falters; Most Rivals Post Gains
articles.snippet: The Gap’s directors are participating in a broad review of the company’s strategy to pull it out of a protracted sales slump.
articles.abstract: The Gap’s directors are participating in a broad review of the company’s strategy to pull it out of a protracted sales slump.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gap’s board, it appears, has had enough.

articles.headline: Lilly Settles With 18,000 Over Zyprexa
articles.snippet: Eli Lilly agreed to pay up to $500 million to people who claimed they had developed diabetes or other diseases after taking Zyprexa.
articles.abstract: Eli Lilly agreed to pay up to $500 million to people who claimed they had developed diabetes or other diseases after taking Zyprexa.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eli Lilly agreed yesterday to pay up to $500 million to settle 18,000 lawsuits from people who claimed they had developed diabetes or other diseases after taking Zyprexa, Lilly’s drug for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

articles.headline: Ford, Lift Up Your Weary Head
articles.snippet: Ford has rapidly seen its position in the auto industry and in its hometown eroded by its failure to combat foreign competition.
articles.abstract: Ford has rapidly seen its position in the auto industry and in its hometown eroded by its failure to combat foreign competition.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich., Jan. 4 — For a half-century, the blue oval logo atop Ford Motor’s headquarters has served as a kind of beacon for the American automobile industry, a signpost for local motorists on area highways and a guidepost for pilots landing at Detroit’s airport nearby.

articles.headline: Bush to Name a New General to Oversee Iraq
articles.snippet: The appointment of Lt. Gen. David H. Petraeus is part of a revamping of the military team that will carry out a new Iraq strategy.
articles.abstract: The appointment of Lt. Gen. David H. Petraeus is part of a revamping of the military team that will carry out a new Iraq strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 — President Bush has decided to name Lt. Gen. David H. Petraeus as the top American military commander in Iraq, part of a broad revamping of the military team that will carry out the administration’s new Iraq strategy, administration officials said Thursday.
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Thom Shanker
